Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater. On upper surface of rim, large rosettes with added red on alternate petals; single diagonal glaze line remains of handle-plate decoration; black-glazed inside; added red bands just below rim on both outside and inside; key maender band on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
T.J. Smith BSA 2003 p. 358, no. 19, fig. 12. The number '1' is written in ink on top of the rim.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0939)
